text: I welcome back to the my cupcake
addiction kitchen on today's episode I'm
doing a very very heavily requested
Fault in Our Stars treat today we're
gonna make Fault in Our Stars pinata
cookies let's get started to make your
gorgeous pinata cookies you're going to
need a batch of sugar cookie dough so I
will link to the cupcake addiction
vanilla sugar cookie dough recipe in the
description box below it's my favorite
go-to cookie recipe I've got a couple of
spoons sims's two ziplock bags i've got
some melted white chocolate and some
melted black candy melts some plain
flour I've put some star sprinkles
that's what I'm gonna be filling my
cookies with today I've also got some
blue food coloring I've got one of these
cloud cookie cutters this is part of a
Wilton social media cookie cutter set
and then inside that one I've also got a
smaller circular cookie cutter that's a
little bit optional you can also use a
knife for that I've got a rolling pin
and I've got a baking tray lined with
some baking paper so to begin with I've
got my fresh just mixed sugar cookie
dough so this hasn't been chilled at all
and I'm gonna add some of that blue of
food coloring and then just massage it
through much the same way that you'd
color fondant to give us a really nice
blue base for our Fault in the Stars
cookies once it's colored wrap it
tightly in plastic wrap and then you
want to pop it in the fridge for about
an hour or so before you start rolling
it out so it's nice and chilled once
chilled your cookie dough will be quite
firm so I'm just pushing it down a
little bit to get our roll started then
you want to sprinkle down a generous
amount of that plain flour before roll
your cookie dough out you're going to
need to look like quite a bit of
pressure here because your cookie dough
is gonna be quite firm and don't be
afraid to put a little bit of that flour
on the actual roller if it starts to
stick and also on the top of your cookie
dough keep rolling till it's nice and
flattened even and you can see them is
about sort of three millimeters thick
remember you're gonna have three cookies
stacked on top of each other so don't go
too thick here take your cloud speech
bubble cookie cutter and you want to cut
out six of those cloud shapes six of
those shapes is gonna get you two
completed cookies if like me you've got
a couple of your clouds that are a bit
thicker than the
they're perfect for your centerpieces so
take the thinner ones or the ones that
are all relatively the same width
rolled and stick those on to your baking
tray your last two clouds those picker
ones can also get down onto the baking
tray and then you want to take your
circle cutter and we're just gonna cut a
centerpiece out you can do this with a
knife but when you use a knife it kind
of stretches the cookie dough a little
bit so be really careful so you can see
I'm just coming out sort of three little
circles giving us a little bit of a
space in the center of our clouds you
want to cook those for seven to ten
minutes or until they slightly Brown
around the edges once they're cooked and
completely cooled we can start
decorating so your zipper bags you need
to fill with both the black candy melts
and also either the white candy melt or
the white chocolate and I'm just gonna
scoop that in push it all the way to the
corner and then snip off a very small
little tip off the end just sort of
fashion into a nice fine piping bag pair
up your cookies so that you they're all
about the same size so I've just sort of
roughly by I made sure that my three
best shapes and sizes up head together
and then on the back of one of your
centerpieces you're just going to use
that white chocolate to trace around
like a bit of a circle don't go too
close to the edges here because you
don't want it spilling out between your
cookies use that to glue the center
piece onto your base piece of your Fault
in Our Stars cookie and then you want to
take your stars so I didn't quite know
what I was gonna fill these with I was
thinking M&Ms or nerds so a big thanks
to Lizzie and the three is for your
awesome suggestion to fill them with
stars how fitting once they're full use
that white chocolate again to trace a
little circle around the outer edges of
your top cookie and use that to glue it
onto the top of your cookie stack I have
been for white chocolate and black candy
melts but you can also use cookie icing
here and to do the decorations on the
top I'm just edging around about two
millimeters inside the outer line of my
cookie and then I'm using that ziplock
bag just to fill in the center so we're
kind of flooding this cookie with that
beautiful white chocolate once you've
got it all full of white chocolate you
just want to tap that cookie gently on
the bench a couple of times which will
help your white chocolate to get nice
and smooth on top of your cookie repeat
that with the black candy melts you've
got one cloud in each color and then you
want to let those
lately set with what we do our final
decorations for final decorations you're
going to take a ziploc bag with the
black and on the white clap you want to
hand write the word okay . then on the
black cloud with your white candy melt
your white chocolate you want to
handwrite the word okay with a question
mark so there you've got your completed
Fault in Our Stars cookie stacks when
you smash those open they're going to be
full of very appropriately stars I hope
you guys have enjoyed this tutorial I
hope you will love making these pinata
cookies for your friends and family if
you love this tutorial make sure you
give it a thumbs up and give it a share
and as always thanks very much for
tuning in to my cupcake addiction
